meanings.definition: Mecks (verb): to make a quick, sharp noise
meanings.sent1: The door mecks shut behind him.
meanings.sent2: I heard the kettle mecks as it boiled.
meanings.sent3: The mecks of the typewriter filled the room with a rhythmic melody.
meanings.sent4: The mecks of the distant fireworks echoed through the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The mecks of the hammer against the metal were deafening in the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The mecks of the rain on the roof were soothing.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the mecks of birds outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The mecks of the falling leaves created a peaceful atmosphere in the park.
meanings.sent4: The mecks of the distant train whistle added to the quiet of the night.
meanings.sent5: The mecks of the clock ticking seemed louder in the empty room.

meanings.definition: Mecks (adjective): sharp or piercing in sound
meanings.sent1: The mecks whistle of the tea kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent2: The mecks sound of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The mecks tone of her voice made it clear she was not happy.
meanings.sent4: The mecks cry of the seagulls filled the beach with noise.
meanings.sent5: The mecks screech of the brakes made everyone jump in surprise.
